CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Albo, 200 Perrysview Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  As for me, I'm never home.  At first, the average family did spend a lot of time watching television.  But it doesn't any more.  There's a greater amount of selection of programs to watch."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Albo, wearing eyeglasses and dark polka dot necktie with tie chain, standing on Liberty Avenue under Jenkins Arcade marquee, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
